intro: Atractocarpus confertus, commonly known as the dense-fruited evergreen, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. Atractocarpus confertus is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
